author: Staff Reporter
text:
A former Assistant Passport Officer (APO) and her husband were awarded four years of rigorous imprisonment in a disproportionate assets case by II Additional District Judge for CBI Cases A.M. Basheer Ahmed here on Monday.

Geetha Bai, who was serving in 2010 as APO in the Regional Passport Office here, was arrested along with a few other employees by the CBI following a raid in February 2010, which allegedly revealed widespread malpractices in issuing passports by entertaining fake documents as proof.

The raid revealed that the irregularities were rampant, with involvement of officials at all levels, agents and even postmen in many areas.

While a case filed against the accused , including Geetha Bai, is still pending, Monday’s judgment was on a separate case slapped at that time by the CBI against the former APO, aged around 60, and her husband Narasimha Bai, both hailing from Andhra Pradesh.

Convicting the two in the disproportionate assets case, Judge Basheer Ahmed also slapped a fine of Rs. 1 lakh on the couple.

The judge also ordered that the government could attach the assets accumulated by the couple disproportionate to their income and Rs.17.5 lakh cash seized by the CBI from their house.
title: Ex-passport official, husband get RI
